member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Actants.ActantRole
member.summary: Greimas' Actantial Model - character role abstraction for templates. This enables character-agnostic story templates where actions reference roles (e.g., "Helper betrays Subject") rather than specific character IDs.
member.remarks:
The actantial model identifies six fundamental roles that appear across all narratives: - Subject/Object axis: The quest relationship (who desires what) - Sender/Receiver axis: The communication relationship (who initiates, who benefits) - Helper/Opponent axis: The power relationship (who assists, who opposes)
Based on A.J. Greimas, "Structural Semantics" (1966).

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Actants.ActantRole.Subject
member.summary: The Subject - who desires and acts. Typically the protagonist who undertakes the quest. Examples: Hero, detective, lover, adventurer.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Actants.ActantRole.Object
member.summary: The Object - what is desired. The goal, person, or state the Subject seeks. Examples: Treasure, beloved, freedom, knowledge.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Actants.ActantRole.Sender
member.summary: The Sender - who initiates the quest. The force or character that sets the Subject on their path. Examples: King, mentor, prophecy, duty, moral imperative.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Actants.ActantRole.Receiver
member.summary: The Receiver - who benefits from quest completion. May be the Subject themselves, or another party. Examples: Kingdom, family, community, the Subject.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Actants.ActantRole.Helper
member.summary: The Helper - who assists the Subject. Provides aid, tools, information, or support. Examples: Sidekick, mentor, magic item, ally.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Actants.ActantRole.Opponent
member.summary: The Opponent - who opposes the Subject. Creates obstacles, challenges, or direct opposition. Examples: Villain, rival, monster, system, fate.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle
member.summary: Generic archive bundle passed from plugin to SDK. The plugin aggregates entries; SDK interprets them.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle.AddEntry``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Adds an entry to the bundle.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle.TryGetEntry``1(System.String,``0@)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve an entry by key.
member.param: The data if found and of correct type; otherwise null.
member.returns: True if the entry was found and is of the correct type.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle.GetNestedArchives
member.summary: Gets all nested archive bundles contained in this bundle. Used for recursive kernel extraction from hierarchical archives.
member.returns: Collection of nested archive bundles, or empty if none exist.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle.GetKeys
member.summary: Gets all entry keys in this bundle.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of entries in this bundle.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveExtractor
member.summary: Extracts narrative-relevant data from archives using opaque keys. The SDK doesn't reference plugins directly - it receives a generic bundle and extracts what it knows how to interpret.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveExtractor.ExtractWorldState(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType)
member.summary: Extract WorldState from an archive bundle using opaque string keys. Unknown keys are silently ignored (forward compatibility).
member.param: The archive bundle containing data entries.
The primary spectrum for the story.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.KernelExtractor
member.summary: Identifies essential narrative events (kernels) from archive data. Kernels are story opportunities - events that could seed new storylines.

remarks.para: The KernelExtractor operates on ArchiveBundle data using opaque string keys. It extracts kernels from known archive types (character, character-history, character-encounter, character-personality) and processes nested archives recursively.
Kernel extraction logic will be fully implemented when Generated archive types are available from the plugin schema generation pipeline (GH Issue #279).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.KernelExtractor.ExtractKernels(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle)
member.summary: Extract narrative kernels from an archive bundle. Returns story opportunities ordered by significance.
member.param: The archive bundle containing data entries.
member.returns: List of narrative kernels sorted by significance (descending).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.KernelExtractor.ExtractFromCharacterArchive(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle,System.Collections.Generic.List{BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel})
member.summary: Extract Death kernels from character archive data. Death is always maximum significance for archived characters.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.KernelExtractor.ExtractFromHistoryArchive(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle,System.Collections.Generic.List{BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel})
member.summary: Extract HistoricalEvent, Trauma, and UnfinishedBusiness kernels from history archive.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.KernelExtractor.ExtractFromEncounterArchive(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle,System.Collections.Generic.List{BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel})
member.summary: Extract Conflict and DeepBond kernels from encounter archive.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.KernelExtractor.ExtractFromPersonalityArchive(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Archives.ArchiveBundle,System.Collections.Generic.List{BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel})
member.summary: Personality archive doesn't directly produce kernels but can adjust scoring.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcControlPoint
member.summary: A control point defining a key position in an emotional arc.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcControlPoint.Position
member.summary: The position in the story (0.0 = start, 1.0 = end).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcControlPoint.Value
member.summary: The emotional/spectrum value at this position.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcControlPoint.Label
member.summary: A label for this control point (e.g., "start", "nadir", "apex", "triumph").

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcDirection
member.summary: The overall direction of an emotional arc - whether it ends higher or lower than it started.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcDirection.Positive
member.summary: The arc ends higher than it starts (positive resolution). Arcs: RagsToRiches, ManInHole, Cinderella.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcDirection.Negative
member.summary: The arc ends lower than it starts (negative resolution). Arcs: Tragedy, Icarus, Oedipus.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcType
member.summary: The 6 emotional arc types from Reagan et al. (2016) computational analysis. These represent the fundamental shapes of emotional trajectories in stories.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcType.RagsToRiches
member.summary: Rags to Riches - Monotonic rise from negative to positive. Pattern: Steady emotional ascent throughout the narrative. Examples: Rocky, The Pursuit of Happyness.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcType.Tragedy
member.summary: Tragedy (Riches to Rags) - Monotonic fall from positive to negative. Pattern: Steady emotional decline throughout the narrative. Examples: Hamlet, Flowers for Algernon.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcType.ManInHole
member.summary: Man in a Hole - Fall-rise (U shape). Pattern: Initial stability, fall into trouble, recovery. The most common arc in popular fiction. Examples: A Christmas Carol, Finding Nemo.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcType.Icarus
member.summary: Icarus - Rise-fall (inverted U shape). Pattern: Rise to success, then collapse. Examples: The Great Gatsby, Breaking Bad.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcType.Cinderella
member.summary: Cinderella - Rise-fall-rise (W inverted shape). Pattern: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph. Most satisfying for audiences according to download data. Examples: Pride and Prejudice, Rocky.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcType.Oedipus
member.summary: Oedipus - Fall-rise-fall (M shape). Pattern: Fall, false hope, final catastrophe. Examples: Oedipus Rex, 1984.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc
member.summary: A complete emotional arc definition loaded from emotional-arcs.yaml.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.Type
member.summary: The arc type identifier.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.ShapePattern
member.summary: The shape pattern (e.g., "fall_rise", "rise_fall_rise").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.Direction
member.summary: The overall direction (positive or negative ending).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.MathematicalForm
member.summary: The mathematical form description (for documentation).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.ControlPoints
member.summary: The control points defining key positions in the arc.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.SampledTrajectory
member.summary: Pre-computed trajectory at 11 sample points (0%, 10%, 20%, ..., 100%).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArc.EvaluateAt(System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluates the arc at a given position using linear interpolation.
member.returns: The emotional value at that position.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcLoader
member.summary: Loads emotional arc definitions from emotional-arcs.yaml.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcLoader.All
member.summary: Gets all emotional arc definitions.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.EmotionalArcLoader.Get(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcType)
member.summary: Gets an emotional arc by type.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.IKernelData
member.summary: Marker interface for type-specific kernel data. Each kernel type has associated data that provides context for story composition.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.DeathKernelData
member.summary: Data for Death kernels - character death information.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.DeathKernelData.CauseOfDeath
member.summary: The cause of death if known (e.g., "battle wounds", "poison", "old age").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.DeathKernelData.LocationId
member.summary: Location where death occurred if known.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.DeathKernelData.DeathDate
member.summary: When the death occurred.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.DeathKernelData.KillerId
member.summary: Character who caused the death, if applicable. Enables revenge arcs when populated.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.TraumaKernelData
member.summary: Data for Trauma kernels - past traumatic experiences.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.TraumaKernelData.TraumaType
member.summary: Category of trauma (e.g., "betrayal", "loss", "violence", "abandonment").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.TraumaKernelData.Description
member.summary: Description of the traumatic event.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.TraumaKernelData.PerpetratorId
member.summary: Character who caused the trauma, if applicable. Enables confrontation or forgiveness arcs.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.ConflictKernelData
member.summary: Data for Conflict kernels - high-impact negative encounters.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.ConflictKernelData.EncounterId
member.summary: The encounter that created this conflict.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.ConflictKernelData.OtherCharacterIds
member.summary: Other characters involved in the conflict.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.ConflictKernelData.SentimentImpact
member.summary: How negative the sentiment was (-1.0 to 0). Lower values indicate more severe conflicts.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.ConflictKernelData.ConflictType
member.summary: Type of conflict if categorized (e.g., "betrayal", "combat", "theft").

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.DeepBondKernelData
member.summary: Data for DeepBond kernels - strong positive relationships.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.DeepBondKernelData.BondedCharacterId
member.summary: The character with whom the bond exists.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.DeepBondKernelData.AverageSentiment
member.summary: Average sentiment across encounters (0 to 1.0). Higher values indicate stronger positive bonds.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.DeepBondKernelData.EncounterCount
member.summary: Number of encounters with this character. More encounters indicate deeper relationships.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.DeepBondKernelData.RelationshipType
member.summary: Type of relationship if known (e.g., "mentor", "friend", "family", "lover").

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.UnfinishedBusinessKernelData
member.summary: Data for UnfinishedBusiness kernels - incomplete goals.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.UnfinishedBusinessKernelData.Goals
member.summary: All unfinished goals for the character.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.UnfinishedBusinessKernelData.PrimaryGoal
member.summary: The primary unfinished goal, if one can be identified.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.HistoricalEventKernelData
member.summary: Data for HistoricalEvent kernels - major event participation.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.HistoricalEventKernelData.EventCode
member.summary: Code identifying the historical event.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.HistoricalEventKernelData.Role
member.summary: Character's role in the event (e.g., "participant", "witness", "instigator", "victim").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.HistoricalEventKernelData.EventId
member.summary: Reference to the event record if available.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.SignificantAssetKernelData
member.summary: Data for SignificantAsset kernels - important possessions.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.SignificantAssetKernelData.AssetId
member.summary: The item or asset identifier.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.SignificantAssetKernelData.AssetType
member.summary: Type of asset (e.g., "weapon", "artifact", "document", "inheritance").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.SignificantAssetKernelData.Significance
member.summary: Description of why this asset is significant.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.SignificantAssetKernelData.StillPossessed
member.summary: Whether the character still possesses this asset. Lost assets create recovery/quest arcs.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.BrokenPromiseKernelData
member.summary: Data for BrokenPromise kernels - unfulfilled commitments.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.BrokenPromiseKernelData.PromiseDescription
member.summary: Description of the promise or commitment.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.BrokenPromiseKernelData.PromiseeId
member.summary: Who the promise was made to.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.BrokenPromiseKernelData.CharacterBrokePromise
member.summary: Whether this character broke the promise (true) or was the victim of a broken promise (false).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.BrokenPromiseKernelData.ContractId
member.summary: Reference to the contract if this was a formal agreement.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelScorer
member.summary: Adjusts kernel significance based on cross-kernel analysis. Implements Lehnert's plot unit connectivity scoring for narrative potential.

remarks.para: Kernels don't exist in isolation - their narrative potential depends on connections to other kernels. A Death kernel connected to a Conflict kernel (same characters involved) has higher story potential than an isolated death.
Based on Wendy Lehnert's plot unit theory which measures story coherence through the connectivity of affect states.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelScorer.AdjustSignificance(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel})
member.summary: Adjust a kernel's significance based on its context within a kernel set. Call this after initial extraction to refine significance scores.
member.param: All kernels in the set for cross-reference.
member.remarks: Adjustment factors include: - Character overlap with other kernels (shared story threads) - Causal potential (e.g., Conflict → Death sequence) - Temporal clustering (events close in time are more connected) - Genre coherence (kernels that fit the same genre boost each other)

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelScorer.ScoreKernelCluster(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel})
member.summary: Score the narrative potential of a kernel cluster. Higher scores indicate richer story possibilities when kernels are combined.
member.returns: Connectivity score from 0.0 to 1.0. Higher values indicate more interconnected kernels with greater narrative potential.
member.remarks: Based on Lehnert's plot unit theory: stories with high affect state connectivity feel more coherent and satisfying. This method measures how well a set of kernels could combine into a unified narrative.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelScorer.SelectBestKernels(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel},System.String,System.Nullable{BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Arcs.ArcType},System.Int32)
member.summary: Find the best kernel subset for a given story goal. Selects kernels that maximize narrative potential for the target genre and arc.
member.param: The desired emotional arc, or null for any arc.
Maximum number of kernels to select.
member.returns: Ordered list of kernels best suited for the story goal.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelType
member.summary: Categories of narrative kernels that can seed stories. Based on Barthes/Chatman kernel theory applied to game archives.
member.remarks: Kernels (Cardinal Functions) are branching points where choices occur; they cannot be deleted without altering story logic. Satellites (Catalyzers) are elaboration and texture that can be freely changed or removed. When compressing or adapting stories, kernels MUST be preserved.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelType.Death
member.summary: Character death - always maximum significance for archived characters. Death is the ultimate irreversible state change.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelType.HistoricalEvent
member.summary: High-significance historical event participation. Wars, disasters, political upheavals that shaped the character.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelType.Trauma
member.summary: Traumatic backstory element. Betrayals, losses, violence that define character motivations.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelType.UnfinishedBusiness
member.summary: Unfinished goals creating narrative hooks. Unfulfilled promises, incomplete quests, unrealized ambitions.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelType.Conflict
member.summary: High-impact negative encounter (grudge potential). Deep conflicts that create lasting enmity.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelType.DeepBond
member.summary: Deep positive relationship (legacy/protection potential). Strong bonds that motivate sacrifice or revenge.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelType.SignificantAsset
member.summary: Major possession or artifact with story potential. Items of significance that drive plots.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.KernelType.BrokenPromise
member.summary: Unfulfilled oath, promise, or contract. Broken or incomplete commitments demanding resolution.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel
member.summary: An essential narrative event that can seed a storyline. Kernels cannot be removed without breaking narrative causality.

remarks.para: From narratology (Barthes/Chatman): Kernels are "cardinal functions" - branching points where choices occur and the story's direction changes. They contrast with "satellites" (catalyzers) which provide texture but can be modified without altering the fundamental story.

The KernelExtractor identifies kernels from archived character data. The lib-storyline plugin then uses these kernels to select appropriate story templates and assign actant roles for story composition.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel.KernelId
member.summary: Unique identifier for this kernel instance.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel.Type
member.summary: Category of kernel determining extraction logic and arc compatibility.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel.Significance
member.summary: Significance score from 0.0 to 1.0. Higher values indicate greater story potential. Death kernels are always 1.0 for archived characters.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel.SourceResourceId
member.summary: The resource ID from which this kernel was extracted.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel.SourceResourceType
member.summary: The type of resource from which this kernel was extracted (e.g., "character", "realm").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel.InvolvedCharacterIds
member.summary: All characters involved in this kernel event. Used for actant assignment during story composition.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel.SuggestedActants
member.summary: Suggested actant roles for involved characters. Key = CharacterId, Value = suggested ActantRole. Null if no suggestions are available.
member.remarks: These are suggestions based on the kernel context. For example, a Conflict kernel might suggest the source character as Subject and the other party as Opponent. The story composer may override these based on the chosen template and narrative goals.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel.CompatibleArcs
member.summary: Arc templates compatible with this kernel. Based on kernel type → arc affinity mapping from narratology.

remarks.para: Affinity mappings are based on: - Death → Tragedy, ManInHole (revenge), Oedipus (tragic cycle) - Trauma → ManInHole (recovery), Cinderella (overcoming) - Conflict → ManInHole, Tragedy - DeepBond → RagsToRiches, Cinderella

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel.GenreAffinities
member.summary: Genre affinities for this kernel. Higher values (0.0 to 1.0) indicate better fit for that genre. Genre keys follow Story Grid conventions (e.g., "action", "love", "horror").

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Kernels.NarrativeKernel.Data
member.summary: Type-specific kernel data containing extraction details. Cast to the appropriate IKernelData implementation based on Type.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Planning.WorldState

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Planning.WorldState.Position

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Planning.WorldState.WithFact(System.String,System.Object)

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Planning.WorldState.WithPosition(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a new WorldState with the specified position.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.GenreSpectrumMapping.SecondarySpectrum

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.NarrativeState

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.NarrativeState.LifeDeath

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.NarrativeState.HonorDishonor
member.summary: Honor vs Dishonor spectrum value. Null if not actively tracked.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.NarrativeState.JusticeInjustice
member.summary: Justice vs Injustice spectrum value. Null if not actively tracked.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.NarrativeState.FreedomSubjugation
member.summary: Freedom vs Subjugation spectrum value. Null if not actively tracked.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.NarrativeState.LoveHate
member.summary: Love vs Hate spectrum value. Null if not actively tracked.

member.summary: The spectrum type identifier.

member.summary: The positive pole label (e.g., "Life").

member.summary: A single pole (stage) in a four-stage spectrum.

member.summary: The numeric value for this pole on the spectrum scale.

member.summary: A description of what this pole represents in narrative terms.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType
member.summary: The 10 Life Value spectrums from Story Grid's Four Core Framework. Each spectrum represents a fundamental human need and the poles of value that stories explore.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType.LifeDeath
member.summary: Life vs Death - Survival domain (Maslow Level 1). Primary for: Action, Thriller, Horror.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType.HonorDishonor
member.summary: Honor vs Dishonor - Safety domain (Maslow Level 2). Primary for: War.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType.JusticeInjustice
member.summary: Justice vs Injustice - Safety domain (Maslow Level 2). Primary for: Crime.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType.FreedomSubjugation
member.summary: Freedom vs Subjugation - Safety domain (Maslow Level 2). Primary for: Western.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType.LoveHate
member.summary: Love vs Hate - Connection domain (Maslow Level 3). Primary for: Love/Romance.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType.RespectShame
member.summary: Respect vs Shame - Esteem domain (Maslow Level 4). Primary for: Performance.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType.PowerImpotence
member.summary: Power vs Impotence - Esteem domain (Maslow Level 4). Primary for: Society.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType.SuccessFailure
member.summary: Success vs Failure - Esteem domain (Maslow Level 4). Primary for: Status.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType.AltruismSelfishness
member.summary: Altruism vs Selfishness - Self-transcendence domain (Maslow Level 5). Primary for: Morality.

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.StorylineTheory.Spectrums.SpectrumType.WisdomIgnorance
member.summary: Wisdom vs Ignorance - Self-actualization domain (Maslow Level 5). Primary for: Worldview.
